history.content: Honestly, don't think a double in CS + Data Science will help too much. Data Science is kind of a subset of Computer Science. 189, 134, 100 is more than enough to land you a ML/Data Science career if you so wish or look into getting involved with student organizations doing ML/Data Science. In addition, pursuing a Master's or phD would be more valuable with the current job requirements online for ML/Data Science jobs. If you care about titles, go for it? Or perhaps look into a minor instead. However, the classes you need to take to complete the double aren't as valuable at your current point.

I'm currently a computer science major, potentially interested in pursuing a career in data science or machine learning. I've already taken 189, 134, and Data 100 and a good chunk of my CS upper divs, so I don't have to take that many more classes to get a double major in Data Science. However, I'm not sure how valuable the double major would be since the two majors seem to have a lot of overlap already and CS kind of encompasses data science to some extent.

Will having the double major in Data Science really help if I already have a degree in CS and have taken relevant courses in data science? On one hand, I really only need to take Data 8 or stat 135, an ethics course, and  domain emphasis courses to get the double major,  but on the other hand, I would have would have more flexibility in my schedule if I didn't do the double major. Any thoughts or advice? Is the double major worth doing?
history.subject: CS + Data Science Double Major?
